name: Homophthalic acid anhydride
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4505
Reason: 1,3,4-Thiadiazole ring: The 1,3,4-thiadiazole ring introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +20°C. The methoxy group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +5°C. The carbonyl group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +5°C. The presence of two phenyl groups can significantly increase the melting point due to their ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C.
